bioQuestions.question: Describe a time in your life when you felt
bioQuestions.answer: On Tuesday I walked to class with a cup of coffee and an apple. I ate the apple, I heard the birds singing. Some girls stopped and said “is that a ratty mug?” It was. “How’d you get that,” she asked. She has yet to live at Brown; she has yet to love at Brown; she has yet to steal mugs from the ratty and jump from the tops of trees. I felt profoundly sorry for this girl, and equally grateful for life as I experienced it.

bioQuestions.question: Thoughts on Thayer Street?
bioQuestions.answer: Usually on Thayer street I think about that one pizza place with the 5$ pizza slices and I wonder who goes there and how regularly. Either they’ve never had really good well-priced pizza, or this is the single greatest pizza place that exists. But surely that can’t be true. Why wasn’t that place on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives? Where’s Guy Fieri nowadays? How’s he doing?

bioQuestions.question: Best argument you won in your head
bioQuestions.answer: Won an argument with myself about chickpeas once. Don’t ask me about it though, I’m a very bad loser.

It was beautiful.

bioQuestions.question: What's an early memory of confronting your own human weakness?
bioQuestions.answer: I remember when I was 6 or so years old I began to realize that eventually I would die, and eventually my family would die, and eventually everyone would die. I became very sad, and I cried. But then my mom gave me her iPod to play Doodle Jump on and I became less sad. Although we may die we cannot allow ourselves to squander life.

bioQuestions.question: Bro, I'm pissed! I'm so pissed!
bioQuestions.answer: We're at the airport right now.  I told the tsa lady that I prolly shouldn’t go through the rotisserie security machine because it's gonna flag me because it's too small.  She agreed but still had me go through the machine.   Damn, the machine flagged me.  The dude next to her started asking me what did I have in my pockets.  I said nothing sometimes the machine just flags me because it's too small.  He told me to empty my pockets.  Damn, there was nothing in em.  Still hadda pat me down.  Minor inconvenience frankly

bioQuestions.question: Who is Talon Johnson?
bioQuestions.answer: Jalon Tohnson is the world #1 Minecraft player, infamous for his complex tunnel strats and days of unbroken focus. Legend has it the man didn’t sleep or eat for 24 hours grinding one of his tunnels on the craft until he found the edge of the seed. He promptly unplugged his computer such that no one else would be able to witness such a sight.

bioQuestions.question: Chart the course of your marriage
bioQuestions.answer: I get married at the age of 27. On my honeymoon, I am approached by John “Doer of Things” Randolph who challenges me to an “UpDating” show for my new bride’s hand in marriage. While I put up a valiant effort, I am unable to beat John’s charisma and Ultiworld fame. My wife leaves me, and I am sad for the remainder of my days.

bioQuestions.answer: Get married at 33, kids at 36, more kids at 39. Brief mid life crisis at 43 brought on by my eldest child’s perennial shortcomings in the t-ball championships, but with the help of a shrink, I work through these problems and direct my kids to the sport of “frisbee″

bioQuestions.question: Are we merely seeing the shadows of reality, or reality itself?
bioQuestions.answer: Learning to play the shadows is the best tip I give to any up and coming frisbee player. If you want the secret, find me outside the classics building at 11pm on the coldest night of the year

bioQuestions.question: What abstract ideal would you lay down your life for?
bioQuestions.answer: Wtf is an abstract ideal

bioQuestions.question: A recent movie you saw + review
bioQuestions.answer:
Disney-Pixar’s Cars (2006): 9.3/10. I watched it on the plane with Siddharth on the way to CCC and it was incredible (no pun intended). It was a 12/10 for nostalgia because from age 4-9 I watched this movie on every flight. The cinematography and animation of the gorgeous Route 66 landscapes is revolutionary especially for a movie from 2006. The soundtrack and score beautifully accompany the film and adds to the brilliant characters that make this film one of the all time greats. 

“Cal, Cars 2 or Cars 3” -Siddharth Yende
“Cars 1 is fantastic” -Cal Nightingale

bioQuestions.question: This is a sign in Providence: "This garden was given by a mother in loving memory of her little girl who loved this spot and who used to walk here with her father when it was part of an attractive ravine." Lame, or rad?
bioQuestions.answer: Rad, we need more historical notes like this one. I wish this sign also came with a photograph of said attractive ravine that would be even more rad.

bioQuestions.question: What else?
bioQuestions.answer: Zach Burpee is an up-and-coming ace up Tuft’s sleeve; key words: up-and-coming. With the agility and stamina of a baby deer, this lanky fcg will jog everywhere on his wobbly stilt legs. He likes to jog under or hover in open space ready to receive a disc on the sideline for few, if any, yards. He will then take his time on every fake and throw to ensure he looks casual doing it. Whether this means throwing a dish with a totally cocked wrist and almost missing his receiver because he wanted to flip the disc with the nonchalance of a unionized Frenchman or tossing a blade-scoober to the far handler in zone with the confidence of an affluent heterosexual white male in America. While he has some skill, he will overestimate his own abilities throwing downfield, or he will mindlessly dump for a loss like someone for whom yards have never been in short supply. When Zach goes deep it is often halfhearted though well timed. He will go deep from a standstill if there is nobody above him as well as after an easily guarded under cut. This is somebody we can bully, and someone we should not fear so long as we are confident in our defensive sets and help each other out.

They have a great conversation where jacques looks at the yahoo sports app to see the nats box score and says “ay lets go big fella”. And most of all they relish the luxury of being able to sit in the silence of a beautiful male friendship

bioQuestions.question: A recent movie you saw + review
bioQuestions.answer: North by Northwest (Hitchcock Movie). I picked this movie out of the 326 offerings on the plane, and I wish I had picked something else. I had watched this move before when I was around 8 years old and I remember I loved it, but looking back that is probably only because I thought that escaping from criminals by climbing down Mt. Rushmore was the coolest thing in the world. The movie overall was solid (as all Hitchcock's are), but the ending of this one was especially outrageous and incomprehensible. 7/10
